comments.body: Are you intentionally keeping the DAML prefix on `contract`?

Yes. I removed it in other cases, but here (and in one place below) I thought it was useful. This is the next thing that is awkward about this document as "contract" has several meanings throughout this document.

1. The set of things about which we want to have a (contract) model.
2. An instance of a template (on a ledger).
3. Sometimes, loosely refers to the template defining it. In cases where 2. has not been made.

I would make a lot more changes to these documents, but `git` is just the wrong tool for this. So, I wanted to limit this change to an independent, small-delta commit.

And, I can be completely, wrong about this. After you stare at some text long enough, you lose your fresh, I-don't-understand-anything, view of the text. So let me know if you want to add the "DAML" back in front of contracts. Though that word is everywhere here.
